availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph J. Toy (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky farmer and private. Maryland native. Married to Cynthia Toy. Father of George Toy, Thomas Toy, Montgomery Toy, Minerva Toy, Ann Toy, and Robert Toy. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed James Hatton as a laborer in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 54th Pennsylvania infantry as private. Served in Simmonds' Independent Battery, Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private. Farmer in Bath County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
